name: Saint-Louis

name: Baie Lazare
description: Baie Lazare features stunning beaches and great conditions for surfing, perfect for all skill levels.

name: Glacis
description: Glacis is known for its scenic coast and reliable waves, making it a popular surf destination.

name: La Digue
description: La Digue offers beautiful surroundings and unique surf spots, ideal for adventurous surfers.

name: Western Area
description: Western Area in Sierra Leone is celebrated for its picturesque beaches and developing surf scene.

name: Eastern Cape
description: The Eastern Cape is renowned for its stunning coastline and world-class surf spots, particularly Jeffreys Bay, celebrated for its perfect right-hand point break.

name: KwaZulu-Natal
description: KwaZulu-Natal offers a diverse range of surf conditions, with warm waters and famous breaks like Umhlanga and Durban, attracting surfers year-round.

name: Western Cape
description: The Western Cape boasts some of the best surf spots in the country, with scenic waves and vibrant surf culture in areas like Cape Town.

name: Príncipe
description: Príncipe offers pristine beaches and consistent waves, making it a hidden gem for adventurous surfers seeking unspoiled surf conditions.

name: São Tomé Island
description: São Tomé Island features diverse surf spots, with a mix of beach breaks and reef waves, ideal for surfers looking for both challenge and beauty.

name: Zanzibar
description: Zanzibar is famous for its warm waters and consistent swells, attracting surfers to its idyllic beaches and vibrant local culture.

name: North
description: The North region of Zanzibar offers fantastic surf conditions and stunning beaches, making it a popular destination for both relaxation and adventure.

name: Manyan
description: Manyan is known for its scenic coastline and gentle surf, perfect for beginners and those looking for a laid-back surfing experience.

name: Bizerte
description: Bizerte offers diverse surf spots with consistent waves, making it an attractive destination for local and visiting surfers.

name: Jendouba
description: Jendouba features beautiful coastlines and a few hidden surf spots, ideal for surfers looking to explore off the beaten path.

name: Nabeul
description: Nabeul is known for its vibrant surf culture and consistent waves, attracting surfers from around the region.

name: Tunis
description: Tunis offers a blend of surf spots catering to various skill levels, with warm Mediterranean waters and a lively beach scene.

name: Bir Ganduz
description: Bir Ganduz is characterized by its unique coastline and surf conditions, making it an intriguing spot for adventurous surfers.

name: Boujdour
description: Boujdour features scenic beaches and consistent surf, providing opportunities for both relaxation and thrilling rides.

name: Dakhla
description: Dakhla is renowned for its excellent surf conditions, attracting surfers from around the world to its stunning waves and breathtaking landscapes.

name: Echdera
description: Echdera offers a unique surf experience with its picturesque beaches and reliable waves, appealing to both beginners and seasoned surfers.

name: El Aargub
description: El Aargub features diverse surf spots, providing a variety of wave conditions for surfers of all skill levels.

name: Foum el Oued
description: Foum el Oued is known for its scenic surf spots and consistent swells, making it a popular destination for local surfers.

name: Itmlily
description: Itmlily offers a blend of beautiful scenery and surfable waves, attracting surfers looking for adventure in unique settings.

name: Laayoune Plage
description: Laayoune Plage features stunning coastline and surf conditions, making it a favorite among surfers seeking both thrills and relaxation.

name: Uad Guenifa
description: Uad Guenifa is a hidden gem for surfers, offering beautiful beaches and consistent waves in a tranquil setting.

name: California
description: California offers world-class surf spots from Malibu to Mavericks, with consistent waves and vibrant surf culture.

name: Hawaii
description: Hawaii is the birthplace of surfing, home to legendary breaks like Pipeline and Waimea Bay.

name: Queensland
description: Queensland features the famous Gold Coast and Sunshine Coast with world-class point breaks and consistent waves.

name: New South Wales
description: New South Wales is home to Sydney's famous beaches and the iconic Bondi Beach with consistent waves year-round.

name: Lisbon
description: Lisbon region features Costa da Caparica's endless beach breaks and powerful Carcavelos, delivering quality waves within minutes of Portugal's vibrant capital.

name: Peniche
description: Legendary surf hub home to Supertubos' perfect barrels and Nazaré's record-breaking monster waves at Praia do Norte. This wave-rich peninsula offers world-class breaks for all levels.

name: Ericeira
description: Europe's first World Surfing Reserve boasts Ribeira d'Ilhas' dreamy point break and Coxos' heavy reef, delivering consistent world-class waves along this historic fishing village coastline.

name: Algarve
description: Portugal's southern paradise combines year-round sunshine, warm waters, and dramatic cliff-backed beaches. From Tonel's consistent peaks to Arrifana's long walls, the Algarve delivers perfect conditions for progression.

name: Nouvelle-Aquitaine
description: The legendary heart of European surfing. Hossegor's La Gravière produces some of the world's most perfect sand barrels, while Biarritz's elegant breaks launched surfing across Europe in the 1950s.

name: Basque Country
description: Where mountains meet powerful Atlantic swells. Mundaka's rivermouth delivers Europe's longest left-hand barrel, while San Sebastian's Zurriola brings world-class waves to a stunning urban setting.

name: Andalusia
description: Where Europe meets Africa at the Strait of Gibraltar. Tarifa's wind-whipped beaches catch consistent swells, offering warm Mediterranean waters and a unique blend of Spanish and Moorish culture.

name: Cornwall
description: The beating heart of UK surfing. Fistral Beach hosts international competitions while dozens of hidden coves and reef breaks pepper the rugged coastline, creating Britain's most surf-obsessed county.

name: Scotland
description: Raw North Atlantic power meets dramatic Highland scenery. Thurso East rivals any European reef break, delivering world-class barrels to those brave enough to paddle out in Scotland's frigid waters.

name: Donegal
description: Ireland's wild northwest corner catches the full force of Atlantic storms. The Peak at Bundoran produces perfect waves for the European Championships, while countless slab reefs await the adventurous.

name: Clare
description: Where the Atlantic crashes into Ireland's limestone coast. Lahinch's powerful beach break sits beneath the towering Cliffs of Moher, offering consistent waves and traditional Irish hospitality in equal measure.
